title: Topic 001 Question 168
body: A security team wants to limit access to specific services or actions in all of the teamâ€™s AWS accounts. All accounts belong to a large organization in AWS Organizations. The solution must be scalable and there must be a single point where permissions can be maintained.
What should a solutions architect do to accomplish this?
options: Create an ACL to provide access to the services or actions.
Create a security group to allow accounts and attach it to user groups.
Create cross-account roles in each account to deny access to the services or actions.
Create a service control policy in the root organizational unit to deny access to the services or actions.
